{{questions-we-have-answers}}

How much does Premiere Pro cost?
The cost of Premiere Pro depends on the plan you choose. As a single app, Premiere Pro costs PRICE - ABM - Premiere Pro plan {{small-tax-incl-label}} for individuals and PRICE - ABM - Premiere Pro {{small-tax-excl-label}} per license for teams. You can also get Premiere Pro in the Creative Cloud All Apps plan, which comes with 20+ additional creative apps like Photoshop and After Effects. The All Apps plan costs PRICE - ABM - Creative Cloud All Apps 100GB {{small-tax-incl-label}} for individuals, PRICE - ABM - Creative Cloud All Apps 100GB {{small-tax-incl-label}} for the first year for students who meet the eligibility requirement, and PRICE - ABM - Creative Cloud All Apps {{small-tax-excl-label}} per license for teams. All options give you access to all the latest Premiere Pro features and updates, Frame.io for Creative Cloud, an Adobe Express Premium plan, and 100GB of cloud storage. You can start with a seven-day free trial of {{premiere-pro}} , or see plans and pricing .
What export formats does Premiere Pro support?
Premiere Pro supports a wide range of file formats including H.264, H.265 (HEVC), Apple ProRes, MPEG-2, MPEG-4, AVCHD, and native camera formats like Canon and Sony RAW, as well as a wide variety of codecs in a QuickTime (MOV) or MXF container. See all supported formats .
Can I buy Premiere Pro as a perpetual license?
No. Premiere Pro is available only as a membership, with options for a monthly or an annual commitment.
Does Premiere Pro have free transitions?
Yes, Premiere Pro includes free transitions, templates, and animated titles to level up your content.
How much does Premiere Pro cost for students and teachers?
Students and teachers can get the All Apps plan, including Premiere Pro, for PRICE - ABM - Creative Cloud All Apps 100GB {{small-tax-incl-label}} for the first year and PRICE - ABM - Creative Cloud All Apps 100GB after that. Learn more .
